gmm_equalizer.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 # See README.md for more info
4 
5 import numpy as np
6 import random
7 import csv
8 
9 ### Requires @param{number_of_trajectories} number of files named data%d.txt in path @param{path}
10 
11 path ="/home/tejas/data/gmm/"
12 number_of_trajectories = 4
13 reshaped_name = "_reshaped.txt"
14 
15 trajectories = [] # create an empty array
16 size = []
17 
18 print("Trajectories acquired : ")
19 for i in range(number_of_trajectories):
20  trajectories.append([]) # Add another dimension each time another trajectory is to be loaded
21  file_name = path+"data"+str(i)+".txt"
22 
23  with open(file_name) as csv_file:
24  csv_reader = csv.reader(csv_file, delimiter='\t')
25  for row in csv_reader:
26  trajectories[i].append(row)
27 
28  print("{} has shape : {}".format(i,np.asarray(trajectories[i]).shape))
29  size.append (np.asarray(trajectories[i]).shape[0])
30 
31 min_size = min(size)
32 print("{} is the minimum size between all trajectories, reshaping to this".format(min_size))
33 
34 difference = 0
35 reshaped_trajectories = []
36 for i in range(number_of_trajectories):
37  reshaped_trajectories.append([]) # Add another dimension to this array
38 
39  difference = size[i] - min_size # Create a list of UNIQUE random indices, with size equal to the difference of current trajectory from minimum trajectory
40  random_list = random.sample(range(1,size[i]) , difference)
41  random_list.sort()
42 
43  for j,row in enumerate(trajectories[i]): # Drop samples at these random indices
44  if j in random_list:
45  continue
46  else:
47  reshaped_trajectories[i].append(row)
48  print("{} has shape : {}".format(i,np.asarray(reshaped_trajectories[i]).shape))
49 
50 # Write the reshaped trajectories back to file
51 for i in range(number_of_trajectories):
52  file_name = path+"data"+str(i)+reshaped_name
53  with open(file_name, mode='w') as writer_file:
54  writer = csv.writer(writer_file, delimiter='\t', quotechar='"', quoting=csv.QUOTE_MINIMAL)
55  for row in reshaped_trajectories[i]:
56  writer.writerow(row)
